tiled.core
Class TileSet

java.lang.Object
  tiled.core.TileSet

public class TileSet
extends java.lang.Object

todo: Update documentation

TileSet handles operations on tiles as a set, or group. It has several advanced internal functions aimed at reducing unnecessary data replication. A 'tile' is represented internally as two distinct pieces of data. The first and most important is a Tile object, and these are held in a Vector.

The other is the tile image.

addNewTile

public void addNewTile(Tile t)
This method takes a new Tile object as argument, and in addition to the functionality of addTile(), sets the id of the tile to -1.

removeTile

public void removeTile(int i)
Removes a tile from this tileset. Does not invalidate other tile indices. Removal is simply setting the reference at the specified index to null. todo: Fix the behaviour of this function? It actually does seem to todo: invalidate other tile indices due to implementation of todo: NumberedSet.

Parameters:
i - the index to remove

generateGaplessVector

public java.util.Vector<Tile> generateGaplessVector()
Generates a vector that removes the gaps that can occur if a tile is removed from the middle of a set of tiles. (Maps tiles contiguously)

Returns:
a Vector mapping ordered set location to the next non-null tile

getTileWidth

public int getTileWidth()
Returns the width of tiles in this tileset. All tiles in a tileset should be the same width, and the same as the tile width of the map the tileset is used with.

Returns:
int - The maximum tile width

getTileHeight

public int getTileHeight()
Returns the tile height of tiles in this tileset. Not all tiles in a tileset are required to have the same height, but the height should be at least the tile height of the map the tileset is used with. If there are tiles with varying heights in this tileset, the returned height will be the maximum.

Returns:
the max height of the tiles in the set

getTileSpacing

public int getTileSpacing()
Returns the spacing between the tiles on the tileset image.

Returns:
the spacing in pixels between the tiles on the tileset image

getTileMargin

public int getTileMargin()
Returns the margin around the tiles on the tileset image.

Returns:
the margin in pixels around the tiles on the tileset image

getTilesPerRow

public int getTilesPerRow()
Returns the number of tiles per row in the original tileset image.

Returns:
the number of tiles per row in the original tileset image.

This function uses the CRC32 checksums to find the cached version of the image supplied.

Parameters:

Returns:
returns the id of the given image, or -1 if the image is not in the set

addImage

public int addImage(java.awt.Image image)
Adds the specified image to the image cache. If the image already exists in the cache, returns the id of the existing image. If it does not exist, this function adds the image and returns the new id.

Parameters:
image - the java.awt.Image to add to the image cache
Returns:
the id as an int of the image in the cache
